title: 820-00165 Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
message:
HI All,

Macbook air  
Sometimes boots normally and functions 100%.

Other times, fan will spin, with no video or chime.

Board looks good with no obvious signs of corrosion. 

Not a backlight issue.  Will sometimes chime and boot normally. When it does not chime there is no video / backlight.

When it does not boot
- Fan spin 100%
- Draws approx 115 ma on bench power supply

title: 820-00165 Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
message:
Reflow SMC first; may need to reball it.

PLT_RESET_L comes high?

title: 820-00165 Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
820-00165 Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
message:
Not reflowed SMC yet. 

I've been working my way through power rails
I have PP1V05 SUS 1.05v
I no NOT have PP1V5 S0 (Zero Volts) 

Is this consistent with SMC issue / PLT Reset issue or is this an upstream problem?

Kind regards,

James

title: 820-00165 Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
message: OK I checked all the inputs for U7870 and  PP1V5 S0 appeared so maybe never mind. No change in laptop behavior. maybe a misread.

title: 820-00165 Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
message: So unplugged and reconnected battery and charger. Fan now spinning at 100% but drawing 235ma. these random board issues are the most frustrating.

title: 820-00165 Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
message:
Ok another update. I was looking over the board again. I found R7612 looked a little off. A bit of corrosion and damage.
I checked voltages on each side as I did board restarted and then restarted with 500ma draw 

This seems to control REFIN of u7600. Not sure what REFIN does. Given the intermittent nature of the problem, could this explain things?

Tests as 40k resistance instead of 49k.

title: 820-00165 Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
message:
Power on sequence must be completed, before PLT_RESET_L comes high.
Be sure to get VCORE and CPU_VCCST_PWRGD.
